services
Class Navigation

java.lang.Object
  services.Navigation

public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object

Navigates the robot along a route, which is contained in this class the route is set by the search and drop off controllers.

The navigation routine works in the following fashion 1. The robot will check if there are waypoints for the robot to head towards. These waypoints would be defined by other classes, specifically the controllers. 2. The robot will turn towards that waypoint until its approximately lined up. 3. The robot will scan ahead, either just driving, adding points to the stack or calling the Recognize controller. 4. Once the robot got to the destination, the next waypoint will be popped from the stack.

This class makes heavy use of the Odometer class to decide what to do (rotate, drive, etc) and the Drive hardware abstraction class to control the motors. The helper classes Angle is used to do angle processing and Point to store the different waypoints to go to.

Navigation

Method Detail

initializeRoute

private java.util.Stack<Point> initializeRoute()

timedOut

public void timedOut()
This method conducts the actual navigation. The issue with navigation however is that a considerable amount of scanning and point setting must be done here. This is not ideal. Furthermore, the final product experienced a considerable amount of problems as a result of new changes. The robot attempted to "overnavigate" to points and spent much time rotating around a destination it intended to go to.

pause

public void pause()
Pauses this service by stopping the timer.

start

public void start()
Restarts this service by re-initalizing the timer.

alternateRoute

public void alternateRoute(boolean alternate)
This method will store the old route temporarily and shift to a new route. This is used when certain operations need a specific route, but we don't want the old points of interest destroyed.

Parameters:
alternate - If true, the alternate route is engaged. Else the main route is engaged.

setupDeltaPositonAndHeading

private void setupDeltaPositonAndHeading()
Set's up the odometry class variables as necessary. This is what navigation compares against. Relies heavily on the odometer.

travelTo

public void travelTo()
Travels to a destination by driving forward. Also does small amounts of angle correction as well.

turnTo

public void turnTo(double dH)
Does the majority of the angle correction. Stops the forward motion of the robot and simply rotates.

Parameters:
dH - The angle to turn to. This sets the drive controller.

turnToComplete

public void turnToComplete(double angle)
This method rotates the robot forcefully. It ignores whatever waypoints the robots have.

Parameters:
angle - The specific angle to turn to.

calculateRotationSpeed

public int calculateRotationSpeed(double dH)
This method allows the robot to slightly adjust its forward speeds to adjust for small angle discrepancies without calling the turnTo method. Much more graceful movement.

Parameters:
dH - The angle the robot is off from its desired angle.
Returns:
The speed to rotate. This is passed directly to Drive

getRoute

public java.util.Stack<Point> getRoute()

setRoute

public void setRoute(java.util.Stack<Point> route)

addToRoute

public void addToRoute(Point xy)
Adds a Point to the route. Resets scan ahead because this will be the next point to travel to. It is executed right away.

Parameters:
xy - The point to travel to.
